episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky and fascinating facts, including the misidentification of meteorites, arson-committing birds, historical food fights, and a humorous look at unusual names in sports and beyond.

facts.fact: When something thought to be a meteorite actually turns out to be an ordinary rock, it's called a meteor wrong.
In 1461, the mayor of Ja√©n in Spain donated 10,000 eggs to his citizens so they could have a huge food fight.
In 1951, Australia's football team played against England and lost 17-0; the goalkeeper was called Norman Conquest.
